NonXMLResume.TextResume:
October 2017

Arun S. Hendi
ADDRESS

Center for Economic and Social Research
University of Southern California
635 Downey Way
Suite 312
Los Angeles, CA 90089

E-mail: hendi@usc.edu

Citizenship: U.S.A.

POSITIONS

July 2017-	Associate Demographer, Center for Economic and Social Research
Assistant Professor (Research) of Sociology
University of Southern California

October 2015-June 2017	Postdoctoral Fellow (NIA T32 AG000139)
Population Research Institute (DuPRI) and Department of Sociology
Duke University

EDUCATION

2015 Ph.D., Demography and Sociology, University of Pennsylvania

Dissertation Title: "The Demography of Modern Social Transformations"
Committee: Irma T. Elo (chair), Michel Guillot, and Samuel H. Preston

Comprehensive Exams: Demography and Sociology of Aging and the Life Course (with
distinction)

2012 A.M., Demography (with distinction), University of Pennsylvania

2010 A.M., Economics, University of Pennsylvania

2009 B.A., Economics (with distinction), Minor in Statistics, University of Pennsylvania
Magna cum laude, Honors Program (Benjamin Franklin Scholars)
Curriculum Vitae	Arun S. Hendi


RESEARCH INTERESTS

Demography, racial and socioeconomic inequality in health and mortality, marriage and family,
sociology of aging and the life course, demography of cities, globalization, quantitative methods,
formal demography, health of migrants, fertility


PEER-REVIEWED PUBLICATIONS

Hendi, Arun S. 2017. "Globalization and Contemporary Fertility Convergence." Social Forces
96(1): 215-238.

Winner of the Biennial 2013 Etienne Van de Walle Prize for the Best Graduate Student
Paper in Demography

Hendi, Arun S. 2017. "Trends in Education-Specific Life Expectancy, Data Quality, and Shifting
Education Distributions: A Note on Recent Research." Demography 54(3): 1203-1213. (PMCID:
PMC5482278)

Hendi, Arun S. 2015. "Trends in U.S. Life Expectancy Gradients: The Role of Changing
Educational Composition." International Journal of Epidemiology 44(3): 946-955. (PMCID:
PMC4607744)

Hendi, Arun S., Neil K. Mehta, and Irma T. Elo. 2014. "Health Among Black Children by
Maternal and Child Nativity." American Journal of Public Health 105(4): 703-710. (PMCID:
PMC4358160)

Berry, Heather, Mauro F. Guillén, and Arun S. Hendi. 2014. "Is There Convergence Across
Countries? A Spatial Approach." Journal of International Business Studies 45(4): 387-404.
(authors listed alphabetically) (PMCID: PMC4286895)

PAPERS UNDER REVIEW AND IN PROGRESS

Hendi, Arun S. 2017. "Sources of Change in American Marital Life Cycles, 1960-2010." Second
R&R at Demography.

Ho, Jessica Y. and Arun S. Hendi. 2017. "Recent Declines in U.S. Life Expectancy Are Shared
Across High-Income Countries." Under Review.

Hendi, Arun S. 2017. "Disadvantaged Areas or Racial Disadvantage? Geographic Variation in
Black-White Life Expectancy Gaps." Under Review.

Hendi, Arun S. 2017. "The Shifting Age Pattern of the Black-White Life Expectancy Gap."
Under Review.


2
Curriculum Vitae	Arun S. Hendi


Hendi, Arun S. 2017. "A Good Man is Hard to Find: How Normative Change, Educational
Mismatch, Uneven Mortality Declines, and Rising Incarceration Have Lowered Marriage Rates
Among Black Women." In Preparation.

Hendi, Arun S., Irma T. Elo, and Pekka Martikainen. 2017. "Birth Cohorts, Synthetic Cohorts,
and SES Differentials in Longevity: The Implications of Changing Educational Distributions for
Life Expectancy Gradients." In Preparation.

Hendi, Arun S. 2017. "Educational Stratification in Subjective Assessments of Survival." In
Preparation.

OTHER PUBLICATIONS

Hendi, Arun S. 2017. "Immigration and the Health of Black Children." The Evidence Base
(http://evidencebase.usc.edu/?p=2187).

GRANTS

Robert Wood Johnson Foundation	04/2017-10/2018
#544026, Role: PI of Subcontract
The Alarming Stagnation in American Life Expectancy	$100,000

National Institute on Aging	07/2017-06/2018
P30AG043073, Role: PI of Pilot Grant
The Social Determinants of Black-White Life Expectancy Gaps	$32,000

INVITED AND CONFERENCE PRESENTATIONS

Hendi, Arun S., Irma T. Elo, Pekka Martikainen. "Birth Cohorts, Synthetic Cohorts, and SES
Differentials in Longevity: The Implications of Changing Educational Distributions for
Life Expectancy Gradients." Presented at IUSSP International Population Conference,
Cape Town, South Africa. October 2017.

Hendi, Arun S. "The Social Determinants of Recent Improvements in Black Life Expectancy."
Presented at the Resource Center for Minority Aging Research (RCMAR) Meeting, Los
Angeles, CA. September 2017.

Hendi, Arun S. "Disadvantaged Areas or Racial Disadvantage? Geographic Variation in Black-
White Life Expectancy Gaps." Presented at American Sociological Association Annual
Meeting 2017, Montreal, Canada. August 2017.

Hendi, Arun S. "Disadvantaged Areas or Racial Disadvantage? Geographic Variation in Black-
White Life Expectancy Gaps." Presented at Population Association of America Annual
Meeting 2017, Chicago, IL. April 2017.

3
Curriculum Vitae	Arun S. Hendi


Hendi, Arun S., Irma T. Elo, Pekka Martikainen. "Birth Cohorts, Synthetic Cohorts, and SES
Differentials in Longevity: The Implications of Changing Educational Distributions for
Life Expectancy Gradients." Presented at Population Association of America Annual
Meeting 2017, Chicago, IL. April 2017.

Hendi, Arun S., Irma T. Elo, and Pekka Martikainen. "Birth Cohorts, Synthetic Cohorts, and SES
Differentials in Longevity: The Implications of Changing Educational Distributions for
Life Expectancy Gradients." Presented at NBER Cohort Studies Meeting, Los Angeles,
CA. April 2017.

Hendi, Arun S. "Sources of Change in American First Marriages." Presented at the Center for
Economic and Social Research (CESR), University of Southern California, Los Angeles,
CA. February 2017.

Hendi, Arun S., Irma T. Elo, Pekka Martikainen. "The Implications of Changing Educational
Distributions for the Measurement of Socioeconomic Gradients in Life Expectancy."
Presented at the Max Planck Institute for Demographic Research (MPIDR), Rostock,
Germany. December 2016.

Hendi, Arun S. "Geographic Variation in Black-White Life Expectancy Gaps." Presented at
Vanderbilt University, Department of Sociology, Nashville, TN. December 2016.

Hendi, Arun S. "The Implications of Changing Educational Distributions for the Measurement of
Socioeconomic Gradients in Mortality." Presented at American Sociological Association
Annual Meeting 2016, Seattle, WA. August 2016.

Hendi, Arun S. "Sources of Change in American Marital Life Cycles, 1960-2010." Presented at
American Sociological Association Annual Meeting 2016, Seattle, WA. August 2016.

Hendi, Arun S. "Adult Mortality - Discussion." Presented at Population Association of America
Annual Meeting 2016, Washington, DC. April 2016.

Hendi, Arun S. "One Half Century of American Marriage and Divorce." Presented at Duke
University Population Research Institute Seminar, October 2015.

Hendi, Arun S. "Are Socioeconomic Gradients in Mortality Widening? A Skeptical View."
Presented at UNC Chapel Hill Demography Daze, May 2015.

Hendi, Arun S. "The Dynamics of Assortative Mating and the Survivorship of Marriages."
Presented at Duke University T32 Luncheon Series, May 2015.

Hendi, Arun S. "The Dynamics of Assortative Mating and the Survivorship of Marriages."
Presented at Population Association of America Annual Meeting 2015, San Diego, CA.
May 2015.


4
Curriculum Vitae	Arun S. Hendi


Hendi, Arun S. "Trends in U.S. Life Expectancy Gradients: The Role of Changing Educational
Composition." Presented at American Sociological Association Annual Meeting 2014,
San Francisco, CA. August 2014.

Ho, Jessica Y. and Arun S. Hendi. "Trends in U.S. Mortality Below Age 50, 1950-2008: An
International Comparative Perspective." Presented at American Sociological Association
Annual Meeting 2014, San Francisco, CA. August 2014.

Hendi, Arun S. "On the Measurement of Educational Gradients in Mortality." Presented at
Population Association of America Annual Meeting 2014, Boston, MA. May 2014.

Hendi, Arun S., Neil K. Mehta, and Irma T. Elo. "Health Among Black Children by Generational
Status and Parental Nativity." Presented at Population Association of America Annual
Meeting 2014, Boston, MA. May 2014.

Hendi, Arun S. "Globalization and Contemporary Fertility Transitions." Presented at Etienne
Van de Walle Prize Lecture, University of Pennsylvania Population Studies Center
Colloquium, Philadelphia, PA. March 2014.

Hendi, Arun S. "Global Institutional Networks and Contemporary Fertility Transitions."
Presented at American Sociological Association Annual Meeting 2013, New York, NY.
August 2013.

Hendi, Arun S. "Global Institutional Networks and Contemporary Fertility Transitions."
Presented at Population Association of America Annual Meeting 2013, New Orleans,
LA. April 2013.

Berry, Heather, Mauro F. Guillén, and Arun S. Hendi. "Is the World Becoming Smaller?
Globalization and Convergence Across Countries." Presented at World Bank Trade
Seminar (by Mauro Guillén), Washington, D.C. May 2011.

PROFESSIONAL ACTIVITIES

Member, Population Association of America, 2011-present
Session Organizer: Adult Mortality I and Adult Mortality II, 2016 Annual Meeting

Member, American Sociological Association, 2012-present
Sections: Sociology of Population, Methodology, Family, and Aging and the Life Course

Reviewer for Age and Ageing, American Sociological Review, American Journal of Sociology,
Demography, Epidemiology, JAMA, PLoS One, Population Health Metrics, Population Research
and Policy Review, Social Science & Medicine


5
Curriculum Vitae	Arun S. Hendi


FELLOWSHIPS, AWARDS, AND HONORS

Resource Center for Minority Aging Research Fellow, USC, 2017-2018
Etienne Van de Walle Prize 2013 for Best Graduate Student Paper in Demography (awarded
biennially)

TEACHING EXPERIENCE

University of Delaware

Office, UNIX, LaTeX
